title: 2 Simple Ways to Send an Object to the Back of Google Slides

steps.title: Open a project in Google Slides.
steps.content: Open a project in Google Slides . You can also create a new one . [1] X Research source You can use Google Chrome , Safari, Mozilla Firefox , or another browser. If you aren't already logged in, click Sign in to do so now or create an account .

steps.title: Click the object you want to move.
steps.content: Click the object you want to move. This can be an inserted image, text, table, shape, or other. To upload an image, click Insert → Image → select your preferred upload method. When the object is selected, it will have a blue border around it.

steps.title: Click Arrange in the top toolbar.
steps.content: Click Arrange in the top toolbar. You can also right-click the object to access the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Order, then Send to back.
steps.content: Click Order , then Send to back . This will send the object to the back of the slide. You can also use the shortcut CTRL + Shift + ↓ (Windows) or CMD + Shift + ↓ (Mac). If you don't see this option, the object is already placed in the back. This method is helpful if you need to wrap text around an object.

steps.title: Open a project in the Google Slides app.
steps.content: Open a project in the Google Slides app. You can also create a new project. [2] X Research source Google Slides is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . If you aren't already signed in, tap Sign in to do so now, or create an account.

steps.title: Double-tap the slide you want to edit.
steps.content: Double-tap the slide you want to edit. You can also long-press the slide and tap Edit Slide .

steps.title: Tap the object you want to move.
steps.content: Tap the object you want to move. This can be an inserted image, text, table, shape, or other. You can also add videos . To upload an image, tap + → Image → From photos or From camera . When the object is selected, it will have a blue border around it. Options will appear underneath.

steps.title: Tap Send to back.
steps.content: Tap Send to back . This will send the object to the back of the slide. If you don’t see this option, you may need to click > to expand your options.
